startScreen.title: State Diagnostic
startScreen.subtitle: Discover your current state of mind through a personalized assessment

quiz.title: State Diagnostic
quiz.progressNote: Answer honestly, without pressure. This helps understand how you're feeling right now.

results.interpretationNote: The interpretation is approximate and doesn't replace a specialist. Save your result if you’d like to discuss it later.
results.ctaDescription: Give yourself time. Rest without guilt. Bring back into your life what used to help — gently, without force.

tips.title: Tips
items: Take short pauses, even if it feels like it’s “not the right time.”
Speak honestly with loved ones — it reduces pressure.
Seek support if the condition lasts for a long time.

levelDescriptions.mild: You're in the zone of gentle fatigue. It's important to rest before tension grows higher.
levelDescriptions.moderate: Fatigue has built up over time. Try slowing down, removing unnecessary pressure, and adding more self-care.
levelDescriptions.high: The level of exhaustion is high. You may want to consider support from a specialist and revising your routine.
levelDescriptions.critical: Your body and mind are at their limit. You need a pause and help. Move slowly and carefully.

q1.text: How do you usually wake up in the morning?

options.a: There’s interest, I understand why I get up
options.c: Empty, I want to stay in bed

q2.text: How often do you feel like you’re living on autopilot?

options.a: Rarely, usually I'm in touch with myself

q3.text: Which of these states are familiar to you?

q4.text: How do you react to the idea of starting something new?

options.c: With resistance — like there's no energy

q5.text: What most often prevents you from moving forward?

q6.text: How do you handle load and pressure?

options.c: Most of the time I push myself
options.d: I've reached the point of overload

q7.text: Is it hard for you to ask for support?

options.d: I almost never ask for help

q8.text: When you need to make a decision, what do you feel?

q9.text: How often do you avoid social interaction?

q10.text: What happens when you try to rest?

q11.text: Which emotions occur most often now?

q12.text: How do you respond to attention and requests from loved ones?

options.b: Sometimes it's hard but I can do it
options.d: I don't want to engage at all

q13.text: Do you feel like you've lost connection with who you used to be?

q14.text: What do you most often feel about your future?

q15.text: Which things have become harder to do?

q16.text: How often do you wish you could disappear for a while?

q17.text: How do your responsibilities feel to you?

q18.text: What thoughts about yourself show up most often?

options.e: I want a break from everyone

q19.text: How do you feel about your past hobbies?

q20.text: What has become harder to feel?

q21.text: How do you feel about your “masculine role”?

options.c: It feels more like a mask
options.d: I’ve lost my sense of self in it

q22.text: How are your discipline and routines?

q23.text: Which states most often knock you off track?

q24.text: How do you feel your energy?

q25.text: What do you need the most right now?

q26.text: Do you feel like you're living someone else’s life?

q27.text: How do you feel your body?

q28.text: How often do you forget your own needs?

q29.text: Which actions have become the hardest?

q30.text: Do you feel like you need a reset?

q31.text: What gives you strength most often?

q32.text: If you had a free day without obligations — what would you choose?

q33.text: How do you usually deal with internal conflicts?

options.b: I worry but find a solution
options.d: I get stuck in them for long

q34.text: What would you like to bring back into your life?

q35.text: How do you see your current self-esteem?

q37.text: What is most important to restore right now?

q38.text: Which areas of life have “collapsed” the most?

q39.text: What prevents you from recovering faster?

q40.text: What would you like to receive after this test?

options.a: A map of directions to move toward

info1.title: Take a moment to reflect
info1.description: You're doing great. Take your time and answer honestly.

info2.title: Understanding your feelings
info2.description: Every answer helps us understand your current state better.

info3.title: You're halfway there
info3.description: Keep going. Your honest responses are valuable.

info4.title: Almost finished
info4.description: Just a few more questions. You're doing well.

info5.title: Final stretch
info5.description: You're almost done. Thank you for your patience and honesty.
